issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
On a 3.2.1 HA Eucalyptus cloud, anytime I launch an instance in the default security group, the instance launches, but does not have any network connectivity.  If I launch an instance in another security group - e.g. neo4j-cluster - instances always get network connectivity. Instances are using the same EMI, EKI and ERI.

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-run-instances -k admin --user-data-file cloud-init.config emi-C1613E67 --kernel eki-0F3937E9 --ramdisk eri-0BE53BFD
RESERVATION	r-191A489A	345590850920	default
INSTANCE	i-68CC3EFB	emi-C1613E67	euca-0-0-0-0.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-0-0-0-0.wu-tang.internal	pending	admin	0		m1.small	2013-02-21T00:33:26.223Z	enter-the-wu	eki-0F3937E9	eri-0BE53BFD		monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store									
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-68CC3EFB
RESERVATION	r-191A489A	345590850920	default
INSTANCE	i-68CC3EFB	emi-C1613E67	euca-192-168-55-104.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-106-242-55.wu-tang.internal	running	admin	0		m1.small	2013-02-21T00:33:26.223Z	enter-the-wu	eki-0F3937E9	eri-0BE53BFD		monitoring-disabled	192.168.55.104	10.106.242.55			instance-store									
[root@viking-01 ~]# ping euca-192-168-55-104.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
PING euca-192-168-55-104.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com (192.168.55.104) 56(84) bytes of data.
^C
--- euca-192-168-55-104.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com ping statistics ---
2 packets transmitted, 0 received, 100% packet loss, time 1541ms

[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-run-instances -k admin --user-data-file cloud-init.config emi-C1613E67 --kernel eki-0F3937E9 --ramdisk eri-0BE53BFD -g neo4j-cluster
RESERVATION	r-4EA93ED8	345590850920	neo4j-cluster
INSTANCE	i-F2AB415A	emi-C1613E67	euca-0-0-0-0.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-0-0-0-0.wu-tang.internal	pending	admin	0		m1.small	2013-02-21T00:34:47.536Z	enter-the-wu	eki-0F3937E9	eri-0BE53BFD		monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store									
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-F2AB415A
RESERVATION	r-4EA93ED8	345590850920	neo4j-cluster
INSTANCE	i-F2AB415A	emi-C1613E67	euca-192-168-55-105.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-106-100-236.wu-tang.internal	running	admin	0		m1.small	2013-02-21T00:34:47.536Z	enter-the-wu	eki-0F3937E9	eri-0BE53BFD		monitoring-disabled	192.168.55.105	10.106.100.236			instance-store									
[root@viking-01 ~]# ping euca-192-168-55-105.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
PING euca-192-168-55-105.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com (192.168.55.105) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from eucahost-55-105.eucalyptus (192.168.55.105): icmp_seq=1 ttl=63 time=0.331 ms
64 bytes from eucahost-55-105.eucalyptus (192.168.55.105): icmp_seq=2 ttl=63 time=0.329 ms
^C
--- euca-192-168-55-105.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com ping statistics ---
2 packets transmitted, 2 received, 0% packet loss, time 1248ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.329/0.330/0.331/0.001 ms
{code}

*Information for default security group* 

{code}

[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-group neo4j-cluster

fields.summary: Inconsistent network connectivity for instances launched in different security groups
fields.environment:
*HA*

2 x CLC, Walrus
2 x CC
1 x SC
3 x NC

comments.body: Starting investigation to reproduce.  Will provide more debugging information and logs.
Attached is get_debug.py output of cloud configuration.

Confirmed.  This time, launched 3 instances in the default security group, and 3 instances in the neo4j-cluster security group to make sure the instances were spread across all 3 NCs.  Instances in the default security group can be pinged.  Instances in the neo4j-cluster security group cannot be pinged.

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-run-instances -k admin --user-data-file cloud-init.config emi-C1613E67 --kernel eki-0F3937E9 --ramdisk eri-0BE53BFD -n 3
RESERVATION	r-CA553E5C	345590850920	default

INSTANCE	i-A5473D5C	emi-C1613E67	euca-0-0-0-0.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-0-0-0-0.wu-tang.internal	pending	admin	1		m1.small	2013-02-21T02:50:40.226Z	enter-the-wu	eki-0F3937E9	eri-0BE53BFD		monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store

Attached are the sosreports for all machines that is part of the HA cloud (this includes system configuration, logs, etc.), and a tar-gzipped file of the eucalyptus-cloud DB.  

Please let me know if there is a need for additional information.

With Vic's help, I dug into this a bit more.  Looks like there was a DB corruption issue with regards to the HA setup.  Below shows the difference between the eucalyptus_auth DB:

{code}
### 192.168.39.101

eucalyptus_auth=# select * from auth_account;
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version | auth_account_number | auth_account_name
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+---------------------+-------------------
 4028a7e538573cb50138573cd30a000a | 2012-07-05 06:03:20.326 | 2012-07-05 06:03:20.326 | d5b9d3ac-e697-406e-b714-615c45b14232 |       0 | 345590850920        | eucalyptus
 4028a7e538578ddf013859c00a3e0010 | 2012-07-05 17:45:54.11  | 2012-07-05 17:45:54.11  | ec1bc8b3-e01a-4853-920b-c4e87a7e1db3 |       0 | 807363558492        | hspencer

### 192.168.39.102

eucalyptus_auth=# select * from auth_account;
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version | auth_account_number |   auth_account_name
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+---------------------+------------------------
 4028a7e538573cb50138573cd30a000a | 2012-07-05 06:03:20.326 | 2012-07-05 06:03:20.326 | d5b9d3ac-e697-406e-b714-615c45b14232 |       0 | 345590850920        | eucalyptus
 4028a7e538578ddf013859c00a3e0010 | 2012-07-05 17:45:54.11  | 2012-07-05 17:45:54.11  | ec1bc8b3-e01a-4853-920b-c4e87a7e1db3 |       0 | 807363558492        | hspencer
 4028a7e53d268add013d645a71cd76dd | 2013-03-13 08:24:41.805 | 2013-03-13 08:24:41.805 | f30cdeea-3bb7-440d-9b99-b49f3c090635 |       0 | 315053285402        | hspencer-steady-mobbin
 4028a7e53d268add013d6a87f4f205fd | 2013-03-14 13:12:07.794 | 2013-03-14 13:12:07.794 | 5887d261-671e-4daf-967e-5b68df33ba8b |       0 | 783717450222        | drake
 4028a7e53d268add013d84d7ab3a6c6b | 2013-03-19 15:49:19.418 | 2013-03-19 15:49:19.418 | 18613a7d-9b5d-4c7d-8add-24a4bf58e210 |       0 | 514881913767        | pimptrickgangstaclick
(5 rows)
{code}

After making sure the DBs were in sync (by doing a failover), instances launching in multiple security group was not an issue.

Is there some way this can be added to the QA sequence to confirm?  Please let me know if there are any questions.

[~viglesias], Harold is asking for an additional test to cover and confirm this.

[~hspencer], is your plan to have QA verify then we can close this issue?
There are no steps to reproduce the issue so we cannot add anything to our automated QA at this time.
[~hspencer], just looking for clarification here.  Are you asking for an HA/DB corruption test, or the multiple security group  instance launch test?

Hey [~awithrow],

I am asking for an HA/DB corruption test.  [~viglesias], I checked out the repo here - https://github.com/eucalyptus-qa/ha_clctest - but I wasn't sure when these tests are ran, how many HA failovers we test?  Also, do we test to see if the DBs are the same after each failover (i.e. DB corruption test)?  Regarding reproduction steps, pretty much, this happened after my cloud failed over about 4 times.  After each failover, I launched instances, created/deleted security groups, and created accounts, users and groups.   Let me know if this helps.
